title: Prime Video Presents ONE Fight Night 29 : Rodrigues vs . McManamon
body_text:
Prime Video Presents ONE Fight Night 29: Rodrigues vs. McManamon
Event kicks off this Friday at 8 p.m. EDT/5 p.m. PDT on Prime Video
ONE Championship returns to Prime Video this Friday with ONE Fight Night 29: Rodrigues vs. McManamon. The event will be available exclusively to Prime members in the U.S. and Canada, beginning at 8 p.m. EDT/5 p.m. PDT this Friday, March 7. Prime members enjoy savings, convenience, and entertainment, all in a single membership.
Live from the Lumpinee Stadium in Bangkok, Thailand, the event will showcase a thrilling mix of Muay Thai, MMA, and submission grappling bouts spotlighting some of the worlds greatest martial artists.
Taking place on the eve of International Womens Day, the main event will feature Brazils Allycia Hellen Rodrigues putting her ONE Womens Atomweight Muay Thai World Title on the line against debuting challenger Marie McManamon, who represents the United Kingdom and Ireland. Rodrigues aims to defend her belt for the third time and extend her run as the divisions longest-tenured champion.
In another pivotal womens matchup that could determine the next title challenger in the atomweight Muay Thai division, Hong Kongs Yu Yau Pui will face Polish striker Martyna Kierczynska.
Additionally, fresh off his stunning 28-second knockout of former two-division ONE World Champion Aung La N Sang at ONE 171: Qatar last month, Turkeys Shamil Erdogan is making a swift return to the ring. Erdogan will aim to maintain his undefeated record and secure his second victory when he faces Brazils Gilberto Galvao in a light heavyweight MMA bout.
ONE Fight Night 29s stacked card will feature several high-profile promotional debuts. These include undefeated American MMA fighter Joshua Perreira, Muay Thai stylist Arian Esparza, two-time ADCC World Champion Diogo Baby Shark Reis, ONE Friday Fights contract winner Parham Gheirati, and Road to ONE: Thailand winner Nontachai Jitmuangnon who trains alongside Thai megastar and former ONE Flyweight Muay Thai World Champion Rodtang Jitmuangnon.

Prime members in the U.S. and Canada can watch ONE Championship live events, including ONE Fight Night 29, at home or on the go at amazon.com/ONEChampionship, and across hundreds of compatible devices, streaming from the web or using the Prime Video app on smartphones, tablets, set-top boxes, game consoles, and connected TVs. For a complete list of compatible devices, visit amazon.com/howtostream.
About Prime Video Sports
Prime Video supports a growing lineup of live sports globally, including Thursday Night Football, NBA, NASCAR, the New York Yankees, Overtime Elite, and Premier Boxing Champions in the United States; the NWSL, the WNBA, and ONE Championship in the United States and Canada; NHL Prime Monday Night Hockey in Canada; UEFA Champions League football in Germany, Italy, the United Kingdom & Ireland; Roland-Garros in France; Wimbledon in Germany and Austria; Premier League in Sweden and Denmark; New Zealand Cricket in India; ICC Cricket in Australia; Copa do Brasil football, Serie A football and the NBA in Brazil; boxing and the 2023 World Baseball Classic in Japan; and Chivas in Mexico. While availability varies by marketplace, fans can also subscribe to streaming services such as Eurosport, FOX Sports (Mexico), Viaplay Sport, MLB.TV, NBA League Pass, NBA TV, DAZN (Germany and Spain), and Premiere FC (Brazil) through Prime Video Channels. This is in addition to a selection of Amazon Original documentaries including Kelce, Bye Bye Barry, Coach Prime, Giannis, and the Amazon Original All or Nothing franchise, including All or Nothing: Arsenal, All or Nothing: Juventus, All or Nothing: Toronto Maple Leafs, and All or Nothing seasons with various NFL teams, as well as the NCAAs Michigan Wolverines football team.
About ONE Championship
ONE is the worlds largest martial arts organization, ranking among the worlds top-five sports properties for viewership and engagement with a cumulative reach of over 400 million fans, according to Nielsen. ONE produces and distributes world-class events across more than 190 countries, featuring martial artists and World Champions from over 80 nations and all styles of martial arts, including MMA, Muay Thai, kickboxing, Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, and more. ONE can be viewed on many of the largest global free-to-air and digital broadcasters, including Prime Video, Sky Sports, Globo, beIN SPORTS, Channel 7 HD, Seven Network, SuperSport, DAZN, La Liga TV, Claro Sports, Star Sports, iQIYI, One Sports, U-NEXT, Coupang, NET TV, Vidio, Mediapro, Skynet, Mediacorp, Match TV, and more.
